name: Instant Pot Chicken Cacciatore
description: Instant Pot Chicken Cacciatore! Braised Italian chicken in saucy pasta-friendly form that is bright, acidic, rich, and savory. Just put everything in the Instant Pot and let it go!
keywords: chicken cacciatore, instant pot, chicken dinner, pasta dinner, chicken pasta
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons Simply Nature Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil
1 – 1.5 pounds Simply Nature Organic Chicken Breasts¬†or chicken thighs
1/2 cup dry white wine or Simply Nature Organic Chicken Broth
one 28 ounce can Simply Nature Organic Diced Tomatoes
4 ounces capers, rinsed and drained (okay I like capers a lot so sometimes I add two jars – whoops)

recipeInstructions.text: Dredge the chicken in flour and a pinch of salt. Turn on the saut√© function on the Instant Pot. Add oil, and saut√© the chicken for a few minutes on each side. Remove and set aside (it’s okay if they’re not cooked all the way).
Add onion, mushrooms and garlic. Saut√© until softened. Add wine and let it sizzle out.¬†
Add chicken and all other ingredients to Instant Pot. Cook on high pressure for 15 minutes. Release the pressure.¬†
Shred the chicken. Stir in the capers, butter, parsley and lemon.
Serve with angel hair pasta (for a little extra zazz, toss it with lemon juice and butter). Top the whole thing with more parsley and Parmesan. You did it!

review.reviewBody: Hey, I tried this in the crock pot yesterday, and it worked beautifully.  I even used frozen chicken breasts, and cooked it on high for 2 hours, and low for 2 1/2 or so, and it was delicious!  I sauteed my veggies first, which I think added to the flavor.  Served it over angel hair pasta.  The only thing that would have made it better would have been some crusty french bread!
I'm excited to try this in my new Instant Pot! It looks delicious and I have all the ingredients in my fridge and pantry.
THIS RECIPE LOOKS FANTASTIC. I LOVE HOW FRESH AND LIGHT IT IS. THE PERFECT NEW YEAR RECIPE. THANKS SO MUCH FOR SHARING.

You were a lifesaver for me today! I had a different meal planned for tonight, but I needed to stop at the store and I ended up working late. My other meal requires a bit more elbow grease. Anyway, I received your email today, and I had some frozen thighs in the freezer. Since I needed to stop at the store anyway, I picked up just a couple of items and voila! A beautiful meal, simple for a Monday night, served over zucchini noodles and a salad. Thank you so much - delicious!!! This is a keeper!!
This looks delicious.  Now that I have learned how to use my Instant Pot (without blowing myself up, LOL) I am a little obsessed with it.....this recipe is next!

SO excited about this recipe! I really, really like when you post Instant Pot recipes.  It has been a lifesaver for me but it's hard finding ones that meet my standards for no red meat+ no added sugar or unhealthy stuff + being tasty.  I know when I get a recipe from you it's going to be flavorful because you don't do bland. :-) Trying it tonight for dinner!

This recipe was delicious! I wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect. We got a pressure cooker as a wedding gift and I‚Äôve been apprehensive to use it. This was my first recipe that I used it for and something tells me I‚Äôll be using it a lot more often.

This was amazing!  So delicious that I will be making it for company.  I am new to using my instapot though.  If I double the recipe, would I need to change the amount of time it is cooked?  Thank you!

Really enjoyed this recipe!  Used the "gourmet" method with a Fagor Multicooker - boneless chicken thighs dredged in gluten-free flour, champagne for the white wine, quinoa angel hair for me and regular capellini for my boys.  Thanks for this!

I‚Äôm in the minority here, I followed the gourmet recipe exactly and it was terrible. Bland, soupy consistency even after I mixed some corn starch into some of the sauce separately and added back in. My suspicion is that the giant can of diced tomatoes over powers the entire dish. Yuck
Delish.  It's really good on its own or with a base- noodles, zoodles, rice etc.  Super yummy and easy.
I made this tonight and it was so delicious! So easy and I‚Äôll definitely make again.

Made this for the first time tonight! Mine came out pretty soupy like. Is it supposed to be like that? I ended up just straining it.  And when you say lemon, is it a lemon cut into wedges, lemon juice? Thanks!
This is my second time. I squeezed a half lemon into the whole thing and my son loved it and said I prefer this to your meat spaghetti sauce lol. Husband said it‚Äôs better then my mum‚Äôs. üòÜ
So delicious!! Love how easy this recipe is, especially when you have little ones ‚ô•Ô∏è
